creator: trajano@yahoo.com
text:
When populating objects in the session using a listener, performing an undeploy
would require access to the classes that are part of the web application,
however it appears to be looking up the data in the system class path instead.

No, the conext classloader is correctly set when the manager is stopped. Please
investigate this more.
creator: remm@apache.org
yoavs@computer.org
text:
I just tested it out, and it's the context (not system) classloader being used
when stopping an app.  It's easy to test out by printing the class and address
of the classloaders to System.out in your listener's stop method(s).
